Name: セメタリーセメラレタリー (Cemetery Conqueror)
Description:
ã‚»ãƒ¡ã‚¿ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚»ãƒ¡ãƒ©ãƒ¬ã‚¿ãƒªãƒ¼ (Cemetery Conqueror) is a game from Japan. You are the caretaker at an old cemetery. You hear the voices of the dead call out for their families to visit. But all the graves are dirty and overgrown. You set to restoring the graves, so the families will return again and honour their ancestors.

During the game you use your dice to make money, and then bid in auctions to complete work patterns using cubes, restoring the different graves in the cemetery and expanded your influence over the graveyard.
user summary

Name: ゾンビデル (Zombidel)
Description:
ã‚¾ãƒ³ãƒ“ãƒ‡ãƒ« (Zombidel), meaning 'Zombies & Zilches', is a trick-taking card game from Japan, set in a movie world of zombies. The theme draws heavily on the film Dawn Of The Dead, with the players trying to escape the shopping mall occupied by zombies.

By playing out tricks, you try to remove the weak and useless zombies from your hand, and avoid being killed by stronger zombies. If you can clear your hand of any shopping mall cards, you have got free. Now you need to escape by helicopter or motorbike.

But if you take too long, you might end up back in the shopping mall!

The game is not too serious, the graphic design is humourous instead of gory.
user summary

As of August 2021, we are remaking it with English rules and new illustrations. 
We will be using a kickstarter for it. It's primarily intended to help outside of Japan, so be interested!

Name: It's Contagious!
Description:
It's Contagious! is a pocket card game for fast, fun and strategic game-play. Your goal is to discard all your cards first and have the lowest viral load.

A climbing game (like Rummy and inspired by Escalation), cards are placed in a center pile increasing in count until a player can no longer best the previous amount (or use a Power Card).

Gameplay gets a boost of fun and strategy from a variety of Power Cards and additional rules keeps the game much more exciting.

GAMEPLAY

Players shuffle the deck. Each player is dealt 6 cards. The remaining cards are placed, face down, to create the center pile. The last person sick starts (or last round/game's loser) by playing a card face up to start that round's "Viral Load." Players always draw back up to 6 cards in their hand and play passes clockwise.

The next player then has to beat the current Viral Load's value (or match it using Matched Play). If they can't beat it with a higher card, or are able to utilize a Power Card, then they must take that Viral Load and add it to their own Viral Load. The next round starts with the player who played the last card (except when Contagion™ is played).

Play continues in this manner until all cards in the center pile are exhausted and the game ends when the first person plays their last card. All players then count the total number of cards in their Viral Loads and in their hand (if any are remaining).

-description from designer

Name: Back of House
Description:
Solo dice placement in a restaurant kitchen. Roll dice to determine your crew for the turn. Fulfil orders and manage kitchen events. Make it through your shift (order deck) while maintaining tidiness and morale and you win.

—description from the designer

Name: Cu-Bo
Description:
The players have to move their 3 tokens from their 3 starting spaces to his destination space 7 in the center of the game board. Each player moves on his own track. Movement is determined by 3 dice. On certain results the players may move one ore more tokens and roll again. If a player rolls a result, that does mot allow him to move, the next player takes his turn. A space may be occupied by more than one token. On the roll of 1-1-1 or 1-2-4 (Jule) all 3 tokens are moved back to the starting spaces.

The first player to get all 3 tokens on space 7 wins the game.

Name: Fórmula Perfecta
Description:
Today is Chemistry class and we will have to get the… Perfect Formula!

We will play to create compounds with different liquids and densities (colors and numbers) in a fun way. You will have to think carefully about what type of card to choose at all times, but be careful… special cards can benefit or harm the formula by making it explode!

The objective of the game is to obtain the highest number of points at the end of the game. To get the points you have to build chemical formulas with the cards.

On the player's turn, a liquid or density card is drawn and added to the formula in each player's "test tube".

Well, find special cards that benefit when creating the combination or cards that will make your formula explode.

A fast and fun game for the whole family.

Playing, in addition to developing mental calculation and key competence in science and technology, we help enhance functions such as executive decision-making or working memory.

-description from publisher

Name: Gardeno
Description:
Don't listen to what they say, farming is still fun! Grab some seedlings, hoe, and watering can and try to grow some vegetables during your first year in this hobby full of dirt, effort, and satisfaction!

A co-winner in design category of 1-card Print and Play Contest 2020 packs an action selection mechanics and a bit of dice-rolling right into this compact package.

The game runs through 3 seasons and each season consists out of 6 turns. Each turn roll a die, place in on available spaces and choose one of four actions available. Raise the vegetable dice, eliminate the dice representing costs of farming, and earn the most points.

Players try to beat their best score. On the back of the card  there is a scoring table the player can compare their achieved score with.

-description from designer

Name: Nantes: Un jeu de questions et d'humour sur Nantes et sa metropople
Description:
Nantes: Un jeu de questions et d'humour sur Nantes et sa metropople is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Travel the board representing Nantes and its metropolis and answer questions and riddles.
Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with themes such as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked Nantes and its metropolis.

Name: Kingdoms of Sun
Description:
"The greatest strategists seek to conquer the 5 kingdoms of the sun, for which they will increase the population of each kingdom, gather resources and spiritual energy, to dominate the 5 kingdoms of sun and become the greatest conquerors."

In Kingdoms of Sun we must dominate the largest number of kingdoms to reach the final score, but not only that, we must also obtain gems and develop one of our warehouses to the maximum to add the most points and become the ruler of Kingdoms of Sun. This Roll and Write gives a challenge when choosing which kingdoms we are going to try to conquer, we must be attentive to the actions of the other players who are also looking to conquer the 5 kingdoms.

On his turn, the player will roll the dice, choose one of the results that can serve him and proceed to mark this result on his game sheet, then he can make purchases with gems that he obtains to begin the conquest of one of the 5 chosen kingdoms. At certain times, you must acquire residents to collect more points.

The player who scores the most points in all the kingdoms and for the gems obtained throughout the game will win.

—description from the designer

Name: Generals
Description:
Generals is a strategy game for 2 to 4 players that can be played 1v1 or 2v2. Each player is the commanding general of a faction and must use tactical and strategic resource management to conquer their opponents.

During the game each player has to organize military units on the map, build structures and recruit more units to attack the opponent and gain Victory points.

Four asymmetric factions each with special abilities and skill cards are fighting for success. Upgrades and special carda are available to all players making the game unpredictable and incredibly strategic.

—description from the designer

Name: Arkaroll & Write
Description:
Arkaroll & Write is a roll and write game in which we will pretend to be the pilots of the Arkadya ship, our mission is to destroy the energy blocks that prevent the ship from entering the planet Arkus to leave supplies, at the same time we will score for the blocks of color destroyed, where the pilot who manages to collect the most points throughout the 4 missions will win.
Move from left to right, shoot and get the most points, but be careful you must manage the results of the dice well to be as efficient as possible.
Throughout the game we will evoke the experience of the mythical arcade game of the 80's ... what wonderful years.

In the game you must manage the throwing of the dice so that it is more efficient to be able to move and shoot the colored blocks, you will add points for the different destroyed colored blocks, you must optimize your dice since there are a number of rounds that must be completed before adding scores.

—description from the designer

Name: Pen & Paper Baseball
Description:
Pen & Paper Baseball is baseball you can play in the comfort of your own home. Get some pencils, some paper and a couple dice, gather around the table with a friend or two, and play ball! Ballpark hotdogs and draught beer not included.

P&PB has all the rules you need to play a whole season of baseball - pitching, hitting, fielding and running, with rules for simulating long seasons without playing over 100 games and rules for team development. Several sample teams are included, or roll up your own.

And since baseball fans have been denied Opening Day this year ... P&PB is free until the baseball season begins ... even if takes until 2021.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alie
Description:
2-4 player bluffing and dice rolling card game set in a science-fiction universe.

Each player starts the game with three Eye of Truth cards and ten hero cards.

Heroes have stats (strength, courage, wisdom, honor, and temper) on the back and stats (attack, defense) on the front. Heroes also have abilities ok the front. Players may never look at the backs of their cards.

The attacking player calls out one of the stats from the back of the cards, which could be truth or a lie. The defending player(s) call out the attacker's value for that same stat, which could be true or a lie. The attacking player announces the attack value on his/her card. The defending player(s) also do this regarding the defense value of their card. Finally, each player rolls a die and adds these three values (their die roll, the value they called out from the front, and the value that was called out to them from the back) and the highest value takes the trick and collects all cards played.

If a player believes that a called was false, they may play an Eye of Truth card.

If a player ever runs out of Eye of Truth cards or hero cards, they are out of the game.

Name: Battledigm Core Set
Description: Two players compete as they battle champions to earn medals. Medals are used to buy more champions. Once all champions have been purchased, the players sum the value of their champions to determine the winner.

Name: Roll and Die
Description:
Roll and Die is a roll and write game in which we will summon monsters to kill the humans invading our town. In each round we will use dice rolls to define how many humans appear in different areas of our town and also how many monsters, and from which areas, we can summon. At the end of six game rounds whoever leaves the fewest surviving humans will be the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Contarlos
Description:
Contarlos ("Count Them") is a print and play game based on a deck of UNO cards. The objective is to collect high valued cards by matching the color and using lower valued cards to add up to at least the high value card's number. After 4 rounds, count the total value of the large numbered cards. Whoever has the most points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Scourge of the High Seas
Description:
Take to the seas Pirate Captains! The merchants are over burdened with goods and money and need your assistance to relieve them of their troubles. But be leery! The King's navy is on the lookout for the Jolly Roger. Get your loot, sell it, and be the one with the most wealth at the end of the season by any means necessary!

Scourge of the High Seas is played over 5 rounds where players will move their ship to attack merchants, islands and the navy in order to gain supplies to sell at market in trade for money. Once sold, bury the money and treasure to keep it safe for the end of the game. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

FEATURES

     3-6 players
     90-120 Minute Playtime
     200+ Pieces and Tokens
     Deck of treasure cards


GAMEPLAY
Three to six players can set sail on the ocean to try and gain the most money. Players will search out merchant ships or royal held islands and plunder them for supplies, treasure and money. With the supplies, the players can deliver them to nearby markets for selling to further increase their money. However, a captain's fortune is not safe until they can successfully bury it on the hidden island. Do not hold onto too much loot or another player may decide you are an easier way to grow their fortune.

Each player will have crew tokens to assign positions on their ship board in secret. When all players have made their assignments, everyone reveals their choices and whoever has the most speed will move first. Crew assignments may depend on many factors including wind direction, nearby targets to attack, other players and the navy ships out on patrol.

Each round the merchants and navy move around on trade routes, while the King's islands produce more supplies to be sold at market. Each market has its own demands for the four different types of supplies and it changes as player's sell their ill-gotten goods. In addition, every round has shifting winds making every decision in every round impactful.

Will you go for the island that has a bunch of one resource in hopes the market demand is high? Or will you risk confrontation with the navy to steal from the merchant ships? Perhaps that other pirate ship is too encumbered by its own fortunes and is ripe for the taking. The choice is yours and each game has a different starting layout giving unending variety.

-description from designer

Name: Herobane
Description:
Purchase rooms to improve your dungeon, collect more and more resources to hire exquisite minions, and challenge daring heroes to grow your infamy in this competitive PVE game.

Each turn, the roll of dice determines what resources you receive. Rooms will make your rolls more lucrative, allowing you to purchase better rooms, hire better minions, and use better skills.

Lure in heroes, rolling dice to pit your minions against them. Once you defeat enough, you can lean on your renown to challenge elite heroes for victory points.

-description from publisher

Name: ボードゲーム工場～魔女と弟子たち～ (Boardgamemill ～Witches and Apprentice Fairies～)
Onetop Baseball
Description:
It is a baseball card game that anyone can easily enjoy.

- Various tactical cards reflecting baseball elements
- Easy game rules
Hits or home runs if the pitcher and batter numbers match
- Player stats
Game management using each player's stats

How to play
â‘  They are divided into home team and away team.
â‘¡ Select the first hit.
â‘¢ The attacking player mixes 16 batter cards and the defending player mixes 16 pitcher cards and arranges them as shown in the picture.
â‘£ Each player draws 5 cards from the top of the deck and holds them invisible to the other side.

Game progress
â‘  Each player turns one player card over and puts it in front.
â‘¡ The player playing the batter card shouts “hit” or “home run”.
â‘¢ The player cards are turned over and compared.

When you shout “hit”
If there is a match between the batter card and the pitcher card being compared, it is a hit. (2 numbers match double, 3 numbers match triple) If there is no match, the batter is out.

When you shout “home run”
If the number in the circle of the batter card being compared and the number of the pitcher card match even one, it becomes a home run. If there are no matching numbers, the batter is out.

â‘£ The used cards are stacked on the used card pile, and the number of cards used from the new card pile is taken from the top to continue playing while maintaining 5 cards.
â‘¤ At 3 outs, they change their karate and play with the same rules.
â‘¥ The player who attacked immediately before writes the points earned in the inning on the scoreboard.
â‘¦ If you run out of cards while playing, shuffle the cards you used and reuse them.
â‘§ You can use only one tactical card. (Tactic cards used with player cards are turned over so that the opponent cannot see them and placed next to the player cards being compared.)
â‘¨ The player with the most points wins at the end of the set inning.

Name: Munchkins & Mazes
Description:
Munchkin sees three to six players competing to grab the most loot and defeat the most monsters. Throughout the game, players take turns to ‘kick down the door’ in order to challenge various creatures to battle. Should a player successfully subdue a monster then they gain a level and a collection of loot - which could contain weapons, equipment and spells.

As players gain more levels and loot, they will have to face stronger and stronger monsters - until even their opponents are working directly against them by casting a wide variety of meddling spells. Eventually, players must defeat one last monster in order to reach level 10 and win the game, but they’ll inevitably have to face the slings and arrows of their fellow competitors as well.

Munchkin is back in a whole new addition! Munchkins & Mazes is the most elf-referential Munchkin game yet, with cards inspired by the most popular roleplaying game ever, the latest live streaming crazes, the gaming hobby in general, and even by Munchkin itself! We've updated some of our favorite cards and created a whole lot of new ones in this set that's sure to please anyone who's ever rolled a 20-sided die.

Name: Ahead in the Clouds: Character Pack
Description: The Character Pack consists of 2 new Impacta Skies Industrialist character cards and 9 chipboard tokens for tracking. 8 of the tokens are double sided character tokens to track contracts, and the 9th token is to track the rounds/blimp.

Name: Tall Tales: A Game of Competitive Story-Writing
Description:
Tall Tales is about writing little stories out for each other and coming up with a fairy tale together. It takes something that a lot of people find intimidating and lonely—creative writing—and tries to make it lighthearted, fun, and just a little competitive. (Maybe more than a little for some of us.)

In Tall Tales, your group will write an original story together. Players each write their own scenes and submit them to the group in the hope that their scene will be chosen for the group’s tale. A player wins by scoring the most points, which players score by having other players vote for their scenes and also by voting for the scenes that are popular with other players.

Tall Tales begins with a warm-up called the Quest Round in which players begin to imagine the world they're building together. After the Quest Round, the game plays out over three Scene Rounds. Players in the Scene Rounds each draft a scene for the tale and then anonymously vote on which of the scenes best meets the criteria for the round. The scene with the most votes becomes part of the tale in each Scene Round until your group has a final, three-part tale.

At the end of Round 3, players should count up their point tokens. The player with the most points wins the game. The winner of the game reads the completed tale aloud to the group, and all players live happily ever after.

-description from designer

Name: Thalassophobia
Description:
Thalassophobia: A deathly fear of the ocean’s depths, and for good reason. You are a diver exploring an underwater grotto when your oxygen tank springs a leak. With only six minutes of air left in your tank, can you navigate this oceanic labyrinth and return to the surface in time?

SETUP
Gather all Blinks together into a single cluster. They should appear as murky, dark-blue waters. To begin, long-press a single Blink to turn it into a Diver. Now the clock is ticking, and the game has begun!

GAMEPLAY
When you begin a game, one of your Blinks will turn white, representing your current position on the board. Your air tank, represented by the number of lights on your Blink, has enough air to last for 6 minutes.

The player’s air tank counts down from 6 minutes to 1

Any Blink adjacent to your current position will be visible, showing either open water or entangling seaweed.

The player can see the Blinks immediately adjacent, but the rest are murky

Move to an adjacent open water Blink by clicking it. When you do so, new Blinks will be revealed, and the Blinks you are no longer adjacent to will begin to fade into murky darkness.

By moving their position, the player lights more of their surroundings

As you explore, you may see a glimmer of light either in open water or on some seaweed - move onto that space to ascend towards the surface.


Keep in mind that these chances are fleeting, and can only be spotted if a space is visible, so it’s best to explore as much and as quickly as possible. If you find yourself trapped, you can always rearrange your Blinks to find a way out.

WIN CONDITION
Your goal is to get all the way to the surface and avoid drowning, which requires you to ascend a total of 6 times. Make it all the way to the surface within 6 minutes, and you win the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rocks Off
Description:
Rocks Off is a trivia game about Rock and Metal music, spanning more than five decades, brought to life with the combined knowledge of the staff of the German webmagazine www.powermetal.de.

The game reduces trivia to the core: questions, answers, victory points. Each card contains three questions in three different levels of difficulty, sometimes plus a bonus question about song lyrics. The questions on a card always are about three different bands, musicians or events, so players being confronted with a question about a band they don’t like won’t be punished thrice.

In the two-player-variant, players get a four cards each. The first player asks the questions of his first card starting with the lowest difficulty. If answered correctly, the second question is also read and the same for the third question. The answering player is awarded victory point cards for each question answered correctly based on the difficulty level, then the opponent reads his card. The game continues until all eight cards have been played. The player with the most victory points after these eight to twenty-four question have been asked wins the game.

In the multiplayer variant each player gets one trivia card. Questions are read and tried to answer in turn, first the easiest level of difficulty, then the second and finally the third. Whoever answers a question correctly first receives a victory point card according to the difficulty level of the question. After all questions have been read and victory points have been awarded, the player with the most victory points is declared winner. In case of a tie, all song lyrics questions are asked providing a bonus round after which the winner is determined.

—description from the designer

Name: Treacherous Haven
Description:
A solitaire microgame about trying to escape a treacherous island filled with villainous pirates, tigers, and a raging volcano. The game starts with a small deck, and as the volcano consumes the island, the deck gets smaller and smaller. Press your luck. Keep the necessary cards, while trying to shed the worst. Find food and water to keep your health up. Build a raft or signal a merchant ship, and escape before time runs out.

—description from the designer

Name: Feelinks: Peur Promo Cards
Description: Three cards "Fear"(in French language) for the game "Feelinks" that brings another feeling to the game.

Name: Dans les cordes: Hyper cute card
Description:
A promo card released for Valentine's day in 2020 for the boxing game "Dans les cordes".
There is French text on the card but the icons make it understandable.
The card has to be mixed with other cards to be played.

Name: Worldwide Football: Coup du sombrero
Description:
2 cards (one blue, one red) for Worldwide football.
These two additional action cards have to be mixed with the others to be played.

The text means : Take one action card in the hand of your opponent.

Published with the crowdfunding campaign of the first expansion but later made available.

Name: Worldwide Football: Sauvetage sur la ligne
Description:
2 promotional cards released together during the crowdfunding campaign of the second expansion, but later made available together.

"Sauvetage sur la ligne" can be used on opponent shoots.

Instead of throwing one dice to stop the shoot, play "paper-rock-scissors" with your opponent.

If you win, the shoot is stopped. If not, your opponent scored the goal.

Name: Space Born Horrors: Five Parsecs Scenario 4
Description:
Scenario 4 for Five Parsecs From Home 2nd edition offers up a new breed of creatures to fight in the depths of space, suspiciously silent colonies and abandoned outposts.

10 new encounters are included, which can be met randomly in a regular campaign or deliberately sought out. 
Each features a new creature type with description and nasty new abilities, offering a tough challenge for a battle-hardened party of characters.

Mechanics have also been included for possible additional rewards and even follow up missions as interested organizations pay you to go back in for them.

—description from the publisher

Name: DC HeroClix: Icons Booster Pack
Description:
This booster pack contains 4 randomly selected game figures out of 60 in the DC HeroClix: Icons set.

There are two different box art variants with the same random contents.

—user summary

Name: Swingin' Shoes
Description:
A Topsy-turvy, point wranglin' challenge! 
Players take turns tossing horseshoes to try and ring them onto the suspended pole and platforms. Score a SITTER, a RINGER, or best of all, a HANGER, all while the whole thing swings more and more with every toss! Do you have the skill to score the most points and win?

Name: The Winchester House
Description:
In 1884, under advice from her spiritual advisor, Sarah Winchester began work on a house in California. Starting with an eight room farmhouse, she continued adding and renovating until she died in 1922. She believed she was haunted by the spirits of those killed by Winchester-brand rifles and that by constantly renovating the house she could keep the spirits at bay...

In The Winchester House, you start with a small farmhouse and add tiles to build out your house. Matching colors can give bluffs or debuffs, special rooms will help you keep the ghosts contained. Your goal is to place all your tiles without letting any ghosts escape or having the terror meter cap out.

—description from the designer

Name: Endless Winter: Rivers & Rafts
Description:
Rivers & Rafts is an expansion for Endless Winter: Paleoamericans. It adds new modular tiles to the terrain map, including riverways and unique starting locations. It also introduces landmarks which tribes can control to gain powerful Eclipse phase benefits.

- 3x 3-hex river terrain tiles
- 2x river start/end tiles
- 4x starting location tiles
- 4x wooden rafts  
- 5x landmark pieces
- 5x landmark cards
- 15x tribe cards (warrior)
- 5x animal cards (sea cow)
- 1x sacred stone
- 1x rulebook

-description from publisher

Name: HamJack
Description:
Get ready to stack and attack! Play a fast-paced card game of sandwich action, or learn the deeper tactical mode to make your topping king of the sandwich.

In the Gas Station Sandwich mode, you compete to add your topping cards on the sandwich faster than anyone else. Toppings must match, but bread is a wildcard: anything can go on bread, and bread goes on anything, except bread doesn't go on bread. Bread on bread is not a sandwich.

To win the game here, you race your opponents through 4 hands of 4, playing a card each turn. But if you can overlap more than 2 symbols on the sandwich, madness can ensue. Overlap 3, and give an enemy a card! Overlap 4, and you chain another turn, to place another card.

For the Tactical Sandwich War, territory cubes are added and you can protect parts of the sandwich as your own as you fight for dominance, representing one topping. To win the game, be the first to reach 25 of your topping on the sandwich. On your turn, you play a card with the goals of covering opponents' toppings with bread, gathering guard cubes, blocking off portions of the sandwich for your own use, protecting your own toppings... or preparing to ruin someone else's day.

—description from the designer

Name: Endless Winter: Cave Paintings
Description:
Cave Paintings is an expansion for Endless Winter: Paleoamericans. Each player gets a dry-erase player board which they can connect dots and draw lines onto to unlock powerful one-time bonus actions, ongoing Eclipse phase benefits, and end-game scoring possibilities.

- 4x Dry-Erase Player Boards, with legs
- 4x Dry-Erase Markers with Eraser Caps
- 1x 5th Action Column Tile
- 1x Megalith tile
- 1x Terrain hex tile 
- 1x Glacier Token
- 1x Sacred Stone
- 1x Rest Token
- 5x Culture Cards 
- 15x Tribe Cards (Painter)
- 5x Animal Cards (Hagerman Horse)
- 1x Rulebook

-description from the publisher

Name: Pays De Saint-Malo: Le Jeu !
Description:
Pays De Saint-Malo Le Jeu ! is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Travel the board representing Saint-Malo and its countryside and answer questions and riddles.
Nearly 750 written questions and 150 photos questions with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with themes such as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked Saint-Malo and its country.

Name: Endless Winter: Ancestors
Description:
Ancestors is an expansion for Endless Winter: Paleoamericans. It adds a large variety of new cards into the game, including alternate animals cards, interactive Culture cards, Chief special ability cards, and more...

-description from publisher

Name: Victory at Sea: Rulebook
Description:
The Battle for the Pacific was only the beginning. 
Victory at Sea is the game of naval combat during the Second World War. 
Throughout 1939–45, the nations of the world duelled across the oceans across the globe, only to discover the fundamental nature of naval warfare changing in the face of rapidly developing technologies. 
Now you can play out these confrontations on the tabletop with entire fleets drawn from the Royal Navy, US Navy, Imperial Japanese Navy, German Kriegsmarine or any of the other nations featured in Victory at Sea.

From skirmishes involving single destroyers hunting down merchantmen to the clashing of massive battleships, from invasions of islands across the Pacific to mastering waves of dive bombers, Victory at Sea enables you to fight exciting battles that take place on the oceans of World War II.

This rulebook is the ultimate resource for Victory at Sea players. It contains:

     The complete rules for fighting naval battles, including the use of aircraft, submersibles and coastal defences.
     Detailed background notes on the progression of naval warfare through WWII.
     28 historic scenarios, covering every theatre over the span of the whole war.
     Exhaustive fleet lists for all the major belligerents, providing game statistics for hundreds of unique ships, submarines, aircraft and MTBs.

Name: Victory at Sea: Royal Navy Submarines & MTB sections
Description:
Victory at Sea: Royal Navy Submarines & MTB sections

Submarines: Designed for use in North European and Mediterranean waters, the S-class was manoeuvrable with a noted ability to crash dive extremely quickly. Combined with a large salvo of torpedoes, this was a successful design of pre-war years that was soon updated and put back into production.

MTBs: The Fairmile A was designed from the outset to use prefabricated components that could be produced by small businesses such as furniture manufacturers, which would then be assembled at shipyards. Capable of 25 knots, it mounted a 3-pounder gun and a pair of .303 machine guns, as well as Depth Charge.

Designed with the form of a destroyer’s hull, the Fairmile B (like its predecessor, the Fairmile A) was intended primarily as a submarine-chaser, and so was fitted with Depth Charge. Manufactured in large numbers, the Fairmile B was also famously used on the raid on St. Nazaire.

Capable of 26 knots, the Fairmile C was a motor gun boat, mounting two 2-pounders and eight machine guns of various calibres. It was mainly used for close escort duties and some clandestine missions.

Nicknamed ‘Dog Boat,’ the Fairmile D was highly adaptable and could be fitted with a range of armament that meant it could act as both motor gun and torpedo boat. Some were used by the Royal Air Force for long range rescue of downed airmen.

Contents:
3 S-Class Submarines
4 Fairmile MTB Sections (A,B,C & D)
Ship Cards

—description from the publisher

Name: The Walking Dead: Something to Fear – Shiva Promo Card
Description:
Promo card originally available from the 2020 Game Boy Geek Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
On your turn: You may destroy this card to move one wound to the mob OR to steal up to one Savior and one Walker from another player.

Name: Tournament at Camelot/Avalon: Mischief Promo Card
Description:
Originally available as part of the Game Boy Geek 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
May be used at any time: Before a melee begins, switch seats with an opponent. All cards, powers, and health totals stay with their players.

Discard after use.

Name: Dragon's Bane
Description:
As a famed mercenary seeking to establish your medieval empire, the prophecy has been commoner's talk for a while now: “Of dragon scales gather up 10, and so become the ruler of men!” But your arrival in the desolate lands has presented two hardships. Firstly, dragons don’t give up their scales willingly. And second, you’re not the only one who’s heard the prophecy.

Game play begins with card drafting as players create a unique hand to battle dragons and each other. Play continues in a series of rounds until 1 player wins by ending a round with 10 dragon scales or being the only player with at least 1 health token remaining.

Dragon scales are gained by contributing strength to defeat a dragon, looting from the dragon, or stealing from other players (if you kill another player you gain all of their dragon scales).

Each round has 3 phases.
Phase 1: (every round)
Players simultaneously play cards from their hand face-down. All cards are then revealed and resolved in a predetermined hierarchy (cards of the same hierarchy resolve clockwise from the dragon). 
Phase 2: (triggered only by specific phase 1 cards)
A repeat of phase 1, however only players who have used specific cards during phase 1 can participate.
Phase 3: (every round)
Dragon combat and loot distribution. Players combine their strength in an attempt to defeat the dragon. The dragon player draws the top 3 cards from the dragon deck selecting one to play against all other players. The dragon card increases or decreases the dragon's base strength, often adding targeted abilities*. If the dragon is defeated, all contributing players take dragon scales. If undefeated, all players take 1 damage from the dragon. Looters acquire loot (dragon scales or items) from the dragon irrespective of the outcome.

All non-core cards are discarded before and he role of dragon then shifts one player to the left (their mercenary becomes untargetable for the following round). A new round will then begin, rounds continue in this manner until a winner is determined.


    In a round with 2 or 3 players, the dragon becomes automated. In this case the top card of the dragon deck is chosen and targeted abilities affect all players.


Unique game elements include a mix of card-drafting, simultaneous-play, semi-cooperative and competitive tactics, and playing as both the dragon and dragon attacker (in different rounds).

—description from the designer

Name: Mission Emission
Description:
Mission Emission is a fun and fast, competitive, trick-taking and hand management card game for kids and adults, produced by Nightingame. This game challenges you on a mission to save India's states from global warming!

Each card of Mission Emission represents a state or union territory of India. These cards have 6 environment related stats (called Missions) like Forest cover, Air Quality, Population Density, etc.


     The active player chooses a Mission/category and plays a card. 
     After each player has played a card from their hand in turn order, the player whose card has the highest stat of the chosen Mission wins a Point Card of that Mission.
     Point Cards have victory points mentioned on them, and the player with the most points wins at the end of the game.


The fun lies in the Point Cards—the Point Cards opened later in the game are worth more points, so you may choose to save your best cards for later rounds. But be careful, the Point Cards may run out faster than you think! To add to the fun, some Point Cards are worth negative points, making this a competitive game which will leave you planning, plotting, sacrificing cards, and biting your nails right till the end!

The game rulebook also comes with 2 more alternative sets of rules, and many more on the official website www.nightingame.com, so you can play a new variation every time!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Expansiones #5 y #6
Description:
This game combines two previously separate expansions to Hostage Negotiator (Abductor Pack 5 and Abductor Pack 6).

It includes 32 cards.

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Expansiones #7 y #8
Description:
This item combines two previously separate expansions to Hostage Negotiator (Abductor Pack 7 and Abductor Pack 8).

It includes 33 cards.

Name: Tutankhamun: A Pharaoh's Gift
Description:
Mini-expansion promo for Tutankhamun. This pack features 5 new tiles that can be added to the base game. These tiles include 1 new artifact tile and 2 new gods, each with 2 tiles.

Included in the pack are 6 reference cards that explain the abilities.

Falcon Pectoral artifact tile - This is a single artifact tile that immediately scores two points. Deposit it in the tomb as usual when scored.

Set God Idol tiles (2) - Move up to 2 Artifact tiles from the Underworld to the end of the Nile next to the Tomb, extending the river.

Sekhmet God Idol tiles (2) - Swap an Artifact tile in your collection for any other Artifact tile in the Nile that has an equal or lesser point value printed on it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Accumulus
Description:
Nanodaption of Ahead in the Clouds.

If you haven't already noticed, Nat has been making tiny versions of our already tiny games. Now he takes on Ahead in the Clouds with just one card (plus rules and tokens). This is resource management in a very simple, elegant form.

—description from the publisher


Based on Ahead in the Clouds by Daniel Newman.

Use your limited actions to condense and convert the four basic resources, shared between both players. Bank an action for later or flip the card with a Cloudburst to bring different actions and contracts into play. Time it right to send them out and fill contracts. The first player to fill 3 contracts wins.


Released in the March 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Chill Pill
Description:
Nanodaption of Fever Chill.

Way back at the end of 2015, we released a little wallet game called Fever Chill. It's nearly sold out at this point, but revived by Nat Levan in his line of Nanodaptions that capture the essence of the game in a smaller package. In Chill Pill, you will simultaneously choose actions to try to raise the infection level above 7 without raising the temperature too high.

—description from the publisher


Based on Fever Chill by Kenneth Thompson.

Now you play the viruses competing to infect a body. Players simultaneously infect a part of the body to increase their infection level, but too many viruses in one place also raises the temperature. The doctors always target the virus with the highest temperature, so you can only win by infecting faster than the doctors can treat or outlasting your fellow viruses.

This game is back to basics, with two board variations on one two-sided card and a rule card. Just add 2 tokens per player (and an optional die) to play anywhere from 2-4, 5, 6, or more.


Released in the July 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Dwar7s Fall
Description:
To survive the long and terrible winter approaching, the dwarves need to prepare. It’s time to collect gems, build castles and stock up enough food. The fire dragons are sleeping. The giants of winter, lurking. The fall is precious and is vital to plan your actions wisely.

Dwar7s Fall is a game about collecting gems in order to trade it for food. In the meantime, you also will need to build your dwarf kingdom and slay some monsters. In this game you have multiple paths to winning by carefully choosing your actions.

Players take turns to perform their actions. Each turn you can do 3 actions (place a realm tile, place one dwarf in a tile, or move one dwarf by one tile).

Each tile has a pre-requisite of how many dwarfs of one player are needed to perform one kind of action. For example: emerald mines have always three slots, but you will need only two dwarfs to take one emerald. When this task is done (collect one emerald) your two dwarfs will return to your pool.

When a player completes three goals (both open and secret goals are taken into account), the endgame begins. Players who had not yet played that round make their last turn and then the game ends. The points are calculated and the winner is whoever has more points.


Note:  This edition also contains the special class meeples from Dwar7s Fall: Royal Decrees; the Guardian, the Warrior, and the King. It does not include the Scenario or Royal Decree cards.

Name: Underwater Cities: Cooper & Flexible Friend Promo
Description:
A set of two personal assistant cards, for use with Underwater Cities - New Discoveries:

Cooper - the contract specialist dog: Draw 3 of the discarded Government Contracts. Choose 1 of them and put the other 2 back in the box. Place the card in your playing area. Only you can complete that contract, at any time, during your turn. After completing it, return it to the box.

Flexible Friend - You can always play green cards as if they match the color of any chosen action slot.

Name: Whose Treasure
Description:
Whose Treasure is a card game for people to make the time more enjoyable with friends. Players try to make full completed maps as soon as possible in the FIRST MODE match or as many as possible in the FINAL MODE match. Players take turns to put their cards on the table and draw cards from the deck to keep 4 cards in their hands.

Since many maps are almost complete over time, the game becomes more exciting, so players try to prevent others from completing the maps.

—description from the designer

Name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Eye Karamba
Description:
A new character, Eye Karamba, for SuperP.L.E.X.!

If you haven't played SuperPLEX, it's our 2016 nod to M.U.S.C.L.E. style wrestling. Over the top characters that are slightly out-of-this-world, fighting with extra special unique moves. The game came with 2 characters and we've released a few since (to change it up, or to play as tag teams). Eye Karamba is a massive 4 armed beast that feels like the characters I loved as a kid in the 80's and 90's.

—description from the publisher


Released in the April 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
Families: Game: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

Name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Tag Team Mode Bonus Pack
Description:
Six additional cards for SuperP.L.E.X. to play longer or 4P games. With one base game and a tag team bonus pack, 2 players can play an intense head-to-head Tag Team game. If players have two sets of the game then they can use the bonus pack to play up to 4 players.

Includes 2 new characters for Tag Team action:

     Volcanessa
     C'Food Lou


The bonus pack also includes their finishing moves and 2 tag cards to switch wrestlers.
Families: Game: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

Name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Nerdman
Description:
A 2-card set promo featuring a new character, Nerdman.

Nerdman is based on designer Ryan Cowler's actual wrestling character, P.O.N.G. Ryan is part of Oakland, CA's Hoodslam league.
Families: Game: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

Name: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling: Cage Match Ring Playmat
Description:
A huge playmat that will make your table presence 100% more awesome.

The playmat also includes a unique Cage Match Ring that deals damage to characters that are pushed beyond the turnbuckle spaces.
Families: Game: Super Pocket League Extreme Wrestling

Name: Iron and Fire
Description:
Iron and Fire is a moderate level complexity game covering the battles fought by the Peruvian Ironclad Huáscar during the 1879 War of the Pacific against Chile. It outclassed everything it met but there was only one (think of the SF classic, Ogre, but on the waters this time).

The Peruvian navy owns an ironclad monitor that outclasses everything else afloat in South America.  But can it win a war by itself?  Look at the 1879 "War of the Pacific", between Chile and Peru, which displayed naval technology one notch above the American Civil War.

-description from publisher's website

Name: First Strike!
Description:
First Strike looks at, well, the "first strike" by British airplanes. On Christmas Day, 1914, float planes were brought near land by the earliest "seaplane tenders" and turned loose on an "air reconnaissance" by planes which just happened to be carrying bombs and looking for Zeppelin sheds. There was also hope of luring out the German fleet, and an unexpected result of having the British naval force attacked by German airplanes.

Who would guess the very first "carrier-based air attack" would happen on Christmas Day, 1914? Yes, it happened! British seaplane tenders supported a "reconnaissance" against the German naval base at Cuxhaven . . . carrying bombs in the hopes of destroying the Zeppelin sheds that were there also.  The fleet was attacked by German seaplanes in turn, and a remarkable adventure ended with few casualties on either side. It would make a great movie, but for now, it's a great game!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Under Ten Flags: Hunting the Raider Atlantis 1939-1941
Description:
Under Ten Flags starts early in 1939 when the German merchant raider Atlantis made its way into the South Atlantic to sink and capture Allied cargo vessels. Its crew used their skill in disguising the appearance of the vessel to aid its encounters or avoid enemy warships. The journey of the raider Atlantis lasted for over 600 days and traveled over 100,000 miles.

Follows the 100,000 mile journey of the German "auxiliary cruiser" Atlantis, a "merchant raider" capable of changing its shaped and configuration as well as its flags.  Atlantis is probably the most successful merchant raider of all times when combining total tonnage sunk and how long it forced the Royal Navy to chase it; plus, it captured documents of strategic importance that actually impacted the war.  The "adventure" sounds like something from a movie, and in fact, did inspire one from which our title comes.  Each player is challenged to "do better" than their historical counterparts.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Wild Cats: Hitcat
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Hitcat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club January 2016 package.

January 2016 games were inspired by Pulp Fiction. This should add a little cult film twist to Wild Cats.

You can add the Hitcat to your game for a little taste of being a secret hitman. You want to assess the group and vote with the crowd to tie for the win. If you mess up, you'll make multiple other players win, which is never good.


RULES
You MAY lie. 
The player you vote for is eliminated. This may cause multiple eliminations and multiple winners. You tie for the win if only one player is eliminated.

Name: XXI: The Naval Wonder Weapon 1943-1945
Description:
XXI, a solitaire game set in 1943 that challenges the player (acting as both Speer and Dönitz) to organize and complete construction of a fleet (or at least “enough”) of the new German Type XXI submarine. However this new sub is far larger, more complex and more expensive, and requires much more manpower and scarce resources than previous submarines. Just a few of these new Type XXIs will do nothing. Only a radical transformation in shipbuilding techniques to mass produce the design - and not giving in to setbacks - will enable this “wonder weapon” to arrive in time....

The advanced Type XXI U-boat has the technology needed to survive and thrive in the Allied-controlled seas, and is a potential game-changer to the war's outcome . . . if it can be supplied in sufficient numbers in time.  (In reality, only two went to war.) This is your challenge as a player, operating functionally as both the Naval Commander-in-Chief and Armaments Minister, working to foster production and work around wartime setbacks.

-description from the publisher's website

Name: Wild Cats: Dude Cat
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, The Dude Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club February 2016 package.

It breaks the rules of the game a little, but is thematic perfection. It's also a fun twist on the game when you can mess with people without any worries of messing up yourself.

Here we decided to go with Dude Cat, the cat that has alredy won when the game starts. He doesn't have a worry because he knows that it'll all work out in the end.


RULES
You must LIE. 
You're the Dude Cat, so you've already won.
Have some fun with it.

Name: Wild Cats: Scissorpaws
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Scissorpaws, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club March 2016 package.

Edward Scissorhands. This movie is extremely iconic due to the main character and the clashing 1950's household perfect that he is placed in. It's one of Tim Burton's most well known (and one of 2 Tim Burton films that made 2016's list).

Scissorpaws is a new Wild Cat that votes with 2 fingers (like scissors!). They can point at 1 player or 2. He is trying to eliminate Bad Cat, but could fuel a Wild Cat win if he presses his luck too far.


RULES
You must LIE. 
You vote with two fingers. You can point to multiple players or to one player twice. Votes for you do not count.
You win if Bad Cat is eliminated.

Name: Wild Cats: Cat Pack
Description:
An Oceans 11 inspired Wild Cats card, the Cat Pack, that allows a player to look at and redistribute the roles as they'd like, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club April 2016 package.

This new character stops the game right after it starts, takes all of the cards and distributes them as he/she pleases. Then picks a role to align with. It's fun heady stuff for a fun little headgame.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
IMMEDIATELY REVEAL YOURSELF.
Gather all roles, look, & redistribute as you like. Declare a partner role without revealing the player. You tie for the win if your partner wins.

Name: Wild Cats: Loompa Cat
Description:
A Wonka inspired Wild Cats card, the Loompa Cat that forces a player to rhyme and get rid of any bad eggs, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club May 2016 package.

In the spirit of the film, with the Loompa Cat you need to ask questions in rhymes and you want the bad egg, I mean cat, out of the game. If you are too obvious, the bad cat might turn things around on you and start to rhyme as well. Gotta watch those bad cats.


RULES
You must tell the TRUTH.
The last word of all of your questions must rhyme.
You tie for the win if Bad Cat is eliminated.

Name: Bussin' Around
Description: 2-4 Bus Drivers go head to head in a take-that, pattern-matching, strategy card game about public transportation. Get the most paying customers on and off your bus before the end of the line!

Name: Cow, Tiger, Santa Claus: Alternate Play Rules – Co-op
Description:
A Board Game of the Month Club promo for January 2017 was a new Cooperative Alternate Play Rules set for Cow, Tiger, Santa Claus.

While it's winter-ish here in New Jersey, we still have plenty of long car rides. And instead of everyone fighting, we're going to work together and try to find some tough items (unless you pull the Santa Claus card in the next two weeks, that is).

This new rules card lets players join together and look for items as a group. More eyes should mean more points, but every 15 minutes you need to remove a card from play. When you find an item, it is scored and can not be scored again. As a reward, you may take a card that was removed from play back, and restart your 15 minute timer.


We're hitting the road again in Cow, Tiger, Santa Claus with the Co-Op rules card. This was a planned stretch goal that didn't make it. Instead of competing to be the first to find all three items, you are working as a group to get as many as possible before the clock resets your items.

—description from the publisher

Name: X-tra INNINGS
Description:
The ultimate game of chance

A baseball fan’s game of choice

Game ncludes: Gameboard, player pieces, 1 set of die and score sheets (sample game included) with instructions

Ages 10 to adult for 1, 2 or more players

Name: Wild Cats: Alley Cat
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Alley Cat, a charity card with all proceeds going to the Animal Welfare Association.


RULES
You must tell the TRUTH and LIE.
You win if you are eliminated.

(From the publisher’s Discord, regarding how to tell the truth and lie: “Over the course of the game you must do both“)

Name: Nautilùs
Description:
NautiluÌ€s illustrates an old sailor game from the 18th century, which was popular to play amongst sailors during the crossings of the pacific. The game combines old myths and yarns of the sea.

The goal of NautiluÌ€s is to bring 4 sailors, illustrated by marbles, from the vortex in 60 steps to the safe harbor. Inspired by the game concepts from "Mensch AÌˆrger dich nicht", "Tac" and "Dog", the game is being played in teams(2 against 2). During the ride, the sailors have to face several threats and challenges such as wrong compasses, pirate trips and the legendary white whale Moby Dick. Moby Dick is powerful and merciless - protect yourself from him in a cave in order to reach the save Harbor!

No matter if it´s storm or sunshine - NautiluÌ€s is a must on your next navy!

—description from the designer

Name: Wild Cats: Office Cat
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Office Cat, inspired in Office Space, and delivered in Board Game of the Month Club June 2016 package.

What is better that quitting your terrible office job? Well on this card, it's sticking it out and getting fired. The unemployment kicks in and is technically better. But Office Cat allows you to stick it to the main and quit mid-game. If you do, you are a winner, and the game continues. If you stick around until the end, you can be the only winner.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or Lie. 
You can quit. If you do, you tie for the win. If you stay and are eliminated, you are the only winner.

Name: Wild Cats: Horror Cat
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Horror Cat, inspired in Dr. Frank-N-Furter from The Rocky Horror Picture Show, and delivered in Board Game of the Month Club July 2016 package.

Sticking with audience participation, Horror Cat involves a non-player. Yes, you need to find someone who is not in the game and get them to vote along with you to tie for the win. You can tell them "at the count of three, point to this person" and they may or may not go along with it. If it's the non-players at my game nights, they definitely will not go along with it. So there is an extra level to reading them, just like trying to read other players. At least with other players, the cards guide their intentions. Here, it's wide open.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or Lie.
Before the vote, reveal yourself and ask a non-player to also vote. If you both vote the same, you tie for the win.

Name: Wild Cats: Baseball Furry
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Baseball Furry, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club August 2016 package.

The Baseball Furry (a pun that was unavoidable), is all about voting with the group. No single player can be a gang on their own, so you need to watch for cues and follow along. OR better yet, you can lead the group. Both are completely valid and depend on your play style or surroundings.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you vote alone, your vote doesn't count. If you vote with majority, you tie for the win.

Name: Silver: Prince Promo Pack
Description:
A promo for Silver from Bezier Games. This was available as a part of the Game Boy Geek Season 8 Kickstarter campaign.

The card has a value of 3 and says, "When faceup: Your faceup cards are protected from opponents."

If you have a Prince faceup in your village, other players may not remove, flip, or modify any of your faceup village cards in any way.

Other players may give you additional faceup cards, as long as they are not required to switch for an existing faceup card in your village.

-description from publisher

Name: Wild Cats: Tabby Wiseau
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Tabby Wiseau, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club September 2016 package, inspired on the cult film The Room.

This one is likely our deepest cut in the Cult Film Wild Cats series. But Tabby Wiseau just hates himself. He can vote himself out and actually eek out a win if others join along. You could really deep down try to imitate the most obvious target or take a meta route and just annoy people to see if they vote for you.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
You must vote for yourself.
You win if somebody else also votes for you.

Name: Wild Cats: Rabbit Cat
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Rabbit Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club October 2016 package, inspired on the cult film Donnie Darko.

Sticking with the theme, but bringing in the tangential universe, we have a Rabbit/Cat that makes players take back their votes and vote again.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
You do not vote. Reveal yourself after the vote. Count to three and players vote again. If the eliminated player changes, you tie for the win.

Name: Wild Cats: Drummer Cat
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Drummer Cat, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club November 2016 package, inspired on the cult film This Is Spinal Tap.

We wanted to have fun and feel the effects of spontaneous combustion. So of you lost last round, lose again.


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you were eliminited last game, you are immediately eliminated.
You tie for the win if you are not eliminated.

Name: Wild Cats: Lydia Catz
Description:
A new character for Wild Cats, Lydia Catz, delivered in Board Game of the Month Club December 2016 package, inspired on the cult film Beetlejuice.

Of course this is a card about speaking 3 times. With Beetlejuice as the main theme, we had to go there. It's required. Also a fun sneaky card!


RULES
You may tell the TRUTH or LIE.
If you ask the same question three times without anyone identifying you, the game ends immediately and you win.
Otherwise, you do not vote.

Name: Infinity Defiance: Outcast
Description:
First Infinity Defiance expansion!

The characters of the Defiance, on who’s shoulders rest the fate of the Human Sphere. Named heroes even before they jumped to the far side of the â€‹Acheron â€‹wormhole. Are now considered outlawed.

Marked as infected, and compromised by the insidious Shasvastii and their dangerous Specular Killers. However, even when branded as traitors the crew of the Defiance will do their best to survive.

With the help of Ensign Katherine Cho of O-12, who does not believe the official propaganda of her superiors. Also with mercenary operator Raoul Spector, who has previously worked with Katherine while undercover.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wonky Words
Description:
Wonky Words is a Scrabble-like word game where you form words inside polyomino word holders before placing them.

Grab a shape, insert letters, play your word(s).

No individual turns. Simultaneous game play for fast action.

—description from the publisher

Name: Infinity Defiance: Revenant
Description:
Years after returning from the other side of the Wormhole of Acheron and cleaning out their files, the crew members of the Defiance and a motley crew of collaborators – including Kendriat, an impetuous Morat, and Jaan Staar, a Tohaa with unsettling abilities - serve as freelance agents and soldiers of fortune under the banner of their own mercenary company: The Revenant Mobile Intervention Force.

The MIF owes its name to the Revenant, the current moniker for the old and famous space daring vessel - The Defiance, which was the first human ship to ever reach Combined Army space and return to tell the tale.

Name: Aristotle's Elements and Space
Description:
Aristotle’s Elements and Space is a Greek themed, interactive card game that is fun for the whole family and sure to keep you on your toes.  Lay down your cards featuring Ancient Greek philosophers, mathematicians, and gods and compete with your friends to see which element will triumph.  Best for 3-5 players ages 10+, it only takes 10 minutes to learn and 15 minutes to play.  Choose your cards carefully, call an element of surprise when you’re feeling lucky, and watch out that no one steals your tokens: Open up a box of fun and battle to reign victorious over the table.

—description from the designer

Name: Wild Tile Variant Kit for the Game of ACQUIRE
Description:
The ACQUIRE Wild Tile Variant Kit is made to fit most editions of ACQUIRE games. This kit allows each player to start with a blank tile that can be played on any open square during their turn at any time during the game.

The ACQUIRE Wild Tile Kit includes six (6) blank tiles and an instruction booklet. Tiles are from actual ACQUIRE games that have been painted to hide the designations. The instruction booklet is printed on yellow card stock for maximum durability and readability.

The Wild Tile Variant allows each player to start the game with that one "key" tile that they may need at one point in the game. It increases the ability to create mergers and helps to alleviate frustration when a player has nothing but "bad" tiles and is unable to maintain a foothold in the game. Some games, with the luck of the draw, a player may never need their Wild Tile.

Included with this Wild Tile Kit are Lloyd's Rules of ACQUIRE, which were designed to help eliminate the one-sided games that can occur during the regular game play in ACQUIRE.

(The Wild Tile Variant is an idea conceived by Allan Wright)

—description from the designer

Name: Banned Books: Holden
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Catcher in the Rye by J. D. Salinger, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club January 2018 package.

Holden:
(1) Curses: Advance any Progress Token one space and stall that Power.
(3) Foils: Bump all Progress and Power Tokens on one card to the end of their line.

Name: Banned Books: Celie
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Color Purple by Alice Walker, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club March 2018 package.

Celie:
(1) Independence: Move any Power token back 1 space.
(2) Rebirth: If at only 1 Stamina, reset to starting Stamina (*).

Name: Banned Books: Alice
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books,  from Go Ask Alice by Beatrice Sparks, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club April 2018 package.

Alice:
(2) Express: Reorder the action cards as you would like.
(3) Escape: Eliminate a Power card from the game. (once per game)

Name: Banned Books: Huck
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn by Mark Twain, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club May 2018 package.

Huck:
(1) Accept: Roll a die and move your Stamina to that number.
(3) Deceive: Reverse the lanes to be ordered as 3, 2, 1.

Name: Banned Books: Jerry
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from The Chocolate War by Robert Cormier, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club June 2018 package.

Jerry:
(1) Refuse: Do not flip actions face-down this turn.
(2) Showdown: Roll a die, if the result matches a Power's track, reduce the Power to 1. (can impact multiple Powers)

Name: Banned Books: Old Major
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from Animal Farm by George Orwell, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Club July 2018 package.

Old Major:
(1) Inspire: Shuffle and re-deal the action cards.
(2) Revolt: Skip the Powers this turn.

Name: Zine Game
Description:
Will your zines be the best ones on the shelf? Will you be caught stealing copies?

In Zine Game, players earn points based on supplies, durable bindings, and other issues that zine publishers struggle with. Will you have the next great idea — or will your rivals destroy your hard work before it ever sees the light of day?

Name: Banned Books: Tango
Description:
An additional character for Banned Books, from And Tango Makes Three by Justin Richardson & Peter Parnell, delivered in the Board Game of the Month Clu December 2018 package.

Tango:
(3) Warmth: Use any or all of the face up action cards in any order that you would like. Do not flip or re-order them after using them.

Name: Space Travel Dice
Description:
“Space Travel Dice: The storytelling game with nine wooden dice.”

“Revive the art of storytelling using these nine illustrated wooden dice to create intergalactic adventures. Includes superhuman powers that will make your heroes utterly invincible! Ideal for playing by a log fire, this game will stimulate the imaginations of children and adults alike.”

Rules:
Any number of players.
Roll all eight of the mainly black-sided dice.  Begin telling a story based on the images you rolled. Save the the red-sided die for later rolling and use. Each of the eight mainly black-sided dice have one red ‘@‘ symbol.  This allows you to roll the red die and get a super power based on what you roll.  You can get multiple powers in a story and the build.

You can try telling the story in single die roll sequence or create the story collaboratively by taking turns rolling and adding to the story.

Name: Duell der Sterneköche
Description:
Who is the best cook on board? Will you be faster than your colleagues in providing the crew with tasty food? All without wasting precious ingredients?

Card game with Set collection.

Name: Go monkey go
Description:
Crazy climbing action game.
Wanna get funky?
Do the monkey!
Race your monkey up the tree!
Dump all your marbles into the trunk to win!

Every player starts with 5 coconuts, the first player to run out of coconuts wins. Use the ropes to make your monkey climb the palm tree and pour a coconut on top of the palm tree, the cononut will fall into a player tray at ramdom.

Name: High Rise: Extra Tenants
Description:
5 extra Tenants to play High Rise with! This will bring the number of Tenants in your game from 45 to 50.

The extra tenants are Demolition Company, Entirely Legitimate Business, Stockbroker, Law Firm and Marketing Firm.

These Tenants were included in the original High Rise Kickstarter and pre-order campaigns with remaining stock sold on the publisher's website.

Name: Munchkin: Tails of the Season
Description:
Your newest furry Munchkin friends are back for the holidays! With festive art by Katie Cook, Munchkin Tails of the Season is the purrfect addition to Munchkin Tails (or any other Munchkin game that needs a dose of Christmas magic)!

—description from the publisher

Name: Munchkin Something Fishy
Description:
School is in session!

Either the dungeon has flooded or you took a very wrong turn somewhere because you don't remember The Flaming Hellscape being this damp. No time to look back, however, as there are all sorts of fun new monsters to fight and odd new weapons to do it with. Are you the king of the sea, or will you take a dive? There's only one way to find out — check out Munchkin Something Fishy!

—description from the publisher

Name: Filogenia!
Description:
This game consists of collecting animals that belong to the same family and accumulate the most points according to the way they are played.

The deck consists in 38 cards (36 native animals and 2 rules cards).

Each card includes the name of the species, the family it belongs, the number of members of that family and the points it's worth.

How to collect points? There are 3 ways:
1. Reuniting an incomplete family, you obtain the sum of the points of the cards played.
2. Reuniting a complete family on the board, on different turns, you obtain the sum of the points of the cards + points indicated on the bonus card.
3. Reuniting a complete family in one turn, you obtain double points (from played cards + bonus)

At the start of the game each player has 5 cards, on each turn there are two phases:
1. Draw a card from the deck or discard pile and play a family (complete or incomplete).
2a. Say it's the end of the turn turn.
2b. Or the player can discard a card from the hand, then asking to opponent if he has a card that can be used to complete a family: if he does, he must give it to the player; if he doesn't, the player loses the discarded card.

At the start of the next turn, each player starts draw to complete a hand of 5 cards and start again until the deck is depleted.
